meanings.definition: To make or become less hard
meanings.sent1: She softens the butter before baking.
meanings.sent2: The sun softens the snow on the ground.
meanings.sent3: His jokes always soften the mood in the room.
meanings.sent4: Kindness softens even the toughest hearts.
meanings.sent5: The music softly softens the atmosphere in the room.

meanings.definition: To make less severe or harsh
meanings.sent1: Adding milk softens the strong coffee.
meanings.sent2: Apologizing can soften a tense situation.
meanings.sent3: Her smile softens the strict teacher's expression.
meanings.sent4: Time softens the pain of past memories.
meanings.sent5: A hug can soften the blow of bad news.
